title: Syrian Officer Convicted of Crimes Against Humanity in Landmark Verdict
sub_head: Sentence of life imprisonment for a senior member of the Assad regime sets a precedent for further prosecutions
body:
BERLIN—A senior Syrian officer was convicted of crimes against humanity by a German court, the highest-ranking official to be found guilty for the government’s actions during the country’s civil war in a decision that could pave the way for similar prosecutions.
A former commander in a secret service-run prison in Damascus, Col. Anwar Raslan was sentenced by a court in the city of Koblenz to life imprisonment for his roles in crimes committed by President Bashar al-Assad’s regime.
